access_scores_ems:urgent_3sfca.long_name: Emergency medical services geographic availability (3-step floating catchment areas)
access_scores_ems:urgent_3sfca.short_description: Index of emergency medical services availability based on supply and demand of facilities
access_scores_ems:urgent_3sfca.long_description: Emergency medical services availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a facility is accessible). Weights are defined for the demand for facilities (adult population).
access_scores_ems:urgent_3sfca.statement: The emergency medical services availability for {features.name} is {value}.

access_scores_ems:urgent_cnt.statement: There are {value} emergency medical services facilities in {features.name}.

access_scores_ems:urgent_near_10_median.long_name: Emergency medical services availability by median drive time to the ten closest facilities in minutes
access_scores_ems:urgent_near_10_median.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the ten closest emergency medical services facilities
access_scores_ems:urgent_near_10_median.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the ten closest emergency medical services facilities. Facility location data were collected from the Homeland Infrastructure Foundation-Level Data (HIFLD) repository. Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2021).
access_scores_ems:urgent_near_10_median.statement: The median drive time to the ten closest emergency medical service facilities to {features.name} is {value}.

access_scores_primcare:primcare_3sfca.long_name: Primary care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment areas)

access_scores_primcare:primcare_3sfca.long_description: Primary care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. hhs:childrens_hospitals_per_100k.short_description: Number of children's hospital beds per 100k people.
hhs:childrens_hospitals_per_100k.long_description: Number of children's hospital beds per 100k people, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) children's hospitals as listed by the U.S. Health and Human Services, with number of beds (overall average of 7 day averages) as supply values, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the total population as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distance between hospital locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
hhs:childrens_hospitals_per_100k.statement: There are {value} children's hospital beds per 100k people in {features.name}.

sources.name: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services
sources.location: Hospital > COVID-19 Reported Patient Impact and Hospital Capacity by Facility

food_insecurity_and_cost:Food_Insecurity.short_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods.
food_insecurity_and_cost:Food_Insecurity.long_description: Food insecurity refers to USDA's measure of lack of access, at times, to enough food for an active, healthy life for all household members and limited or uncertain availability of nutritionally adequate foods. Food-insecure households are not necessarily food insecure all the time. Food insecurity may reflect a household's need to make trade-offs between important basic needs, such as housing or medical bills, and purchasing nutritionally adequate foods.
food_insecurity_and_cost:Food_Insecurity.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} are food insecure.

nces:schools_2year_with_science_program_.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with science programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
nces:schools_2year_with_science_program_.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with science programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 41) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 41, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
nces:schools_2year_with_science_program_.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a science program per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
daycare_access_scores:daycare_median_dri.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).

daycare_access_scores:daycare_cnt.long_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations. Address and capacity data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.
